refsect1.title: DESCRIPTION
refsect1.para: gdiff2 compares BRL-CAD models specified on the command line, reporting differences according to the specified options. It supports a plain "diff" comparision between two files, as well as a "3-way" comparison that accepts a third file with "ancestoral" information that provides a context for the left and right files.

listitem.para: Report objects that are the same in both model1.g and model2.g

Control the verbosity of the output. Zero will suppress all reporting and only the return value of the program will contain information, one will provide categorized lists of objects but no details on what changed, two will list each changed object preceeded by a modifier, three will print more details for changed objects, and four will print all available information. All settings for this option will respect other constraints applied to the reporting output.
Set the length tolerance used to compare numerical properties. Units are millimeters. Default value is RT_LEN_TOL.
Apply filters to the diff output, using the same set of filters available in the search command's search. See the search manual page for more details.
Merge the files being diffed into one ouput file.

refsect1.para: The program returns 0 if the files being compared have no differences that satisfy the user-supplied options, otherwise it returns the total number of differing objects that do satisfy the supplied options. Default is to report all differences that rise above RT_LEN_TOL.

example.title: Quieter Diffing Results
example.para:
Running the same comparison as the previous example with a less verbose output gives us a summary, which is useful when first studying two files to identify differences:
~: gdiff2 -v 1 moss.g moss2.g
Objects added: tor2
Objects changed: cone.s, box.s, tor.r, tor

example.title: Filtering Results With Search Filters
example.para:
Let's say, for example, we want a detailed diff output but only for object of type torus. We can filter for such results with the F option:
~: gdiff2 -F "-type tor" moss.g moss2.g tor2 was added.
tor was changed: Parameters changed: r_h: "5.079999923705999620437979" -> "8.882757536664964703732039"

example.title: Filtering Results With Tolerance
example.para:
To eliminate differences that are too small to be of interest, the t is used. What is "too small" is up to the user - in this example, we will use three millimeters:
~: gdiff2 -t 3.0 moss.g moss2.g tor2 was added.
tor.r was changed: Parameters changed: tree: "l tor" -> "l tor2"
tor was changed: Parameters changed: r_h: "5.079999923705999620437979" -> "8.882757536664964703732039"

example.title: Combining Multiple Filters
example.para:
To return *only* results that are large changes, we can apply multiple filters to the output:
~: gdiff2 -c -F "! -type comb" -t 3.0 moss.g moss2.g tor was changed: Parameters changed: r_h: "5.079999923705999620437979" -> "8.882757536664964703732039"
